intro: Psychotria luteola, commonly known as the yellow psychotria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a slightly glossy surface. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
